conversation.text: Based on your preference cues, I recommend "The Equalizer". It is a thrilling action movie that stars Denzel Washington. The movie follows a former CIA agent who now works as a freelance detective. When he gets hired by a wealthy businessman named Martin Stettard (played by Ethan Hawke)), he becomes involved in an investigation that leads to Martin's murder. After the murder, Jack becomes determined to find out who committed the murder and why they did it. With the help of his former CIA partner, David Frost (played by Meryl Streep)), Jack begins his search for clues about the murder. Along the way, Jack faces numerous obstacles and challenges that test his strength, courage, and determination. In the end, with the help of his former CIA partner, David Frost (played by Meryl Streep)), Jack is able to solve the mystery surrounding Martin's murder and find out who committed the murder and why they did it.

Based on the preference cues provided, here are some potential recommendations:

- 'Braveheart': This historical drama film stars Gerard McSorley as William Wallace, David O'Hara as Robert Bruce and Angus Macfadyen as Prince Edward. The movie is set during the English Wars (1387-1405) between England and Scotland, when King Edward III of England orders his army to attack and conquer the Scottish kingdoms of Argyll, Roxburghe and Menteith. William Wallace is a fictional Scottish warrior and national hero who lived in the 12th century and died on July 9, 1305 at Flodden Field during the Battle of Bannock Field between England and Scotland. William Wallace's most famous words are "Hereafter I’ll fight for my country like never before." In this movie, Wallace fights against the English army led by King Edward III (1275-1324)), and ultimately leads his own army to win independence for Scotland. This movie is based on the real-life events of the Wars of Scottish Independence in the 18th century, which resulted in the final defeat of the Scottish Kingdoms of Argyll, Roxburghe and Menteith by the Kingdom of Great Britain (1707-1992)). This movie features a star-studded cast including popular actors such as Patrick McGoohan, Patrick McGoohan, Brendan Gleeson, Brendan Gleeson, Mel Gibson, Mel Gibson, Alun Armstrong and many others. Overall, 'Braveheart' is an epic historical drama film that tells the story of William Wallace (Patrick McGoohan), a fictional Scottish warrior and national hero who lived in the 12th century and died on July 9, 1305 at Flodden Field during the Battle of Bannock Field between England and Scotland. The movie tells the story of William Wallace (Patrick McGoohan)), a fictional Scottish warrior and national hero

Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Flags of Our Fathers" and "The Hunting Party". 

Both movies are based on real-life events during World War II. "Flags of Our Fathers" is a biographical film directed by Oliver Stone that tells the story of six men who raised the flag at the Battle of Iwo Jima. "The Hunting Party" is a war drama film directed by Peter Weir, which tells the story of two U.S. Special Forces soldiers sent to Nigeria in 1964 to rescue a doctor who will only join them if they agree to save 70 refugees too.

Both movies have a strong cast of actors and actresses, including such notable names as Bruce Willis, Cole Hauser, Fionnula Flanagan, and Johnny Messner. 

In addition, both movies have an engaging and captivating plot that keeps viewers interested and entertained throughout the entire movie. 

Overall, based on your preferences, I would recommend "Flags of Our Fathers" and "The Hunting Party".
